column4: Like, it's not going to mess up the xorg to run that command, is basically what I meant to ask
ok, thanks joaopinto, I'll do it, I just hope it doesn't delete all my wife's music

WARNING!!!  Running e2fsck on a mounted filesystem may cause
2008-11-07T19:12:00.000Z	_hase		SEVERE filesystem damage. carry on?
Is it supposed to say that?
what's resuce mode?
and no don't run it now?  k
I'm kind of nervous to do it, cause if It messes up my xorg and I can't log back into the chat I won't have anyway to find help
install irssi, command line irc-client
and backup xorg.conf ;P
I hate to sound like a windows noob, but do I back the xorg just by copying and pasting?
yep thats how its done eaily ;)
thanks!
we've all been noobs, especially me
thank you to everyone helping out, i'm running "sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.backup" that scunizi suggested
do that, and good luck to you!
i hate how the terminal doesn't say if it worked when stuff works, double checking to the xorg backup and then I'm going to reboot into rescue mode
heh thats how it says it went without errors ;P
ok, all backed up, and I installed the command line irc thing
thanks everyone hopefully this works out
remember freenode and #ubuntu :)
